alert.note: Alert for Chaves (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 26 at 2:08PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New Mexico, including extreme southwest Chaves county. This will primarily impact the Four Mile Draw and Walnut Draw. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Heavy rain from earlier storms upstream in Otero county will lead to significant runoff into the Four Mile Draw and Walnut Draw that feed into the Penasco River. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 200 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms upstream in Otero county. This will cause runoff and eventually arroyo and small stream flooding into extreme southwestern Chaves county. While not much rain is currently falling in extreme southwestern Chaves county, between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen upstream which will eventually flow eastward. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dunken and rural southwestern Chaves county. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: Arroyos, streams, and normally dry rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Water in arroyos can travel many miles and take hours to reach your location from upstream rain areas.
